page.title: 10The Ashbourne News Telegraph
page.content: The{Ashbourne News}founded in{1891 and the{Ashbourne Telegraph}founded in{1906}were amalgamated in{1959}to make the{Ashbourne News Telegraph}, known locally as{The Stunner}. The paper is printed at{"Burton {Daily Mail"}head office and delivered on Wednesday night and sold on Thursday.The circulation is over{7000. People that used to live in Ashbourne and live abroad now have it sent to them.The cost of the paper is 16p. In Ashbourne there are{7 staff},2 full time reporters,1 part time reporter,2 receptionists,1 space advertiser and 1 photographer. In 1982 Ashbourne News Telegraph had a scoop. It was an Ashbourne man on South Georgia who asked the{ {Argentinians}to lower their flag.
